intro: Humboltia trichophora, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Humboltia trichophora is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage.
